Package edu.cnm.deepdive.powdr.service

Interface StorageService

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    LocalFilesystemStorageService
    public interface StorageService
    Declares store(MultipartFile), retrieve(String), and delete(String) methods for a file store. The key expectations for implementing and consuming this interface are these:
    • Files will not be updated or versioned; updates must be saved as distinct files.
    • Filenames will not be respected by the file store itself; instead, an opaque String reference, presumed unique, will be returned when a file is stored, and the same reference must be provided when retrieving or deleting a file. On the other hand, this means that a consumer of a service implementing this interface need not be concerned with filename collisions.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method Description
      boolean delete​(java.lang.String reference)
      Deletes the file referred to by the provided opaque reference.
      org.springframework.core.io.Resource retrieve​(java.lang.String reference)
      Retrieves a file from a reference (as returned by store(MultipartFile)), returning a Resource usable by the consumer.
      java.lang.String store​(org.springframework.web.multipart.MultipartFile file)
      Stores the specified file, returning an opaque reference to the file as a String.

    • Method Detail

      • store

        java.lang.String store​(org.springframework.web.multipart.MultipartFile file)
                throws java.io.IOException,
                       org.springframework.web.HttpMediaTypeNotAcceptableException
        Stores the specified file, returning an opaque reference to the file as a String.
        Parameters:
        file - Uploaded file.
        Returns:
        Opaque reference, to be used when retrieving or deleting the file from the store.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - If the file cannot be written for any reason.
        org.springframework.web.HttpMediaTypeNotAcceptableException - If the content-type of file is not allowed.

      • retrieve

        org.springframework.core.io.Resource retrieve​(java.lang.String reference)
                                       throws java.io.IOException
        Retrieves a file from a reference (as returned by store(MultipartFile)), returning a Resource usable by the consumer. When an exception is thrown by this method, the consumer should generally assume that subsequent invocations for the specified file will fail as well.
        Parameters:
        reference - Opaque reference to the file, as returned by store(MultipartFile).
        Returns:
        Consumer-usable Resource.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - If the file cannot be read for any reason.

      • delete

        boolean delete​(java.lang.String reference)
        throws java.io.IOException,
               java.lang.UnsupportedOperationException,
               java.lang.SecurityException
        Deletes the file referred to by the provided opaque reference.
        Parameters:
        reference - Opaque reference String returned from store(MultipartFile).
        Returns:
        true if the file was successfully deleted from the store; false otherwise.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - If the file cannot be accessed (for any reason) from the specified reference.
        java.lang.UnsupportedOperationException - If the file store is write-only.
        java.lang.SecurityException - If the current process does not have permission to delete the specified file.
